meanings.definition: A person who plans or considers an action beforehand.
meanings.sent1: The premeditator carefully thought about his next move in the game.
meanings.sent2: The premeditator made a detailed plan before starting the project.
meanings.sent3: The premeditator decided to bring an umbrella to a sunny beach, just in case.
meanings.sent4: She was a premeditator, always thinking three steps ahead in any situation.
meanings.sent5: The premeditator's strategic thinking helped them avoid many problems.

meanings.definition: To plan or consider an action beforehand.
meanings.sent1: He liked to premeditate his answers before speaking in public.
meanings.sent2: She would premeditate her route before going on a road trip.
meanings.sent3: The chef premeditated adding extra spices to the dish for a surprising twist.
meanings.sent4: The author would premeditate each plot twist to keep readers engaged.
meanings.sent5: The detective premeditated every move to catch the criminal red-handed.
